definitions: the property of having poles or being polar

examples.text: it exhibits polarity when presented to a magnetic needle

shortDefinitions: property of having poles or being polar

definitions: the relative orientation of poles; the direction of a magnetic or electric field

examples.text: the magnetic field peaks in strength immediately after switching polarity

shortDefinitions: orientation of poles or direction of magnetic or electric field

definitions: the state of having two opposite or contradictory tendencies, opinions, or aspects

examples.text: the polarity between male and female
the Cold War's neat polarities can hardly be carried on

shortDefinitions: state of having opposite or contradictory aspects

definitions: the tendency of living organisms or parts to develop with distinct anterior and posterior (or uppermost and lowermost) ends, or to grow or orient in a particular direction

examples.text: the sponge, possessing an axis of polarity, carries an incurrent siphon at one end and an excurrent siphon at the other
the embryo shows polarity: it has a root pole and a shoot pole

shortDefinitions: tendency of organisms to develop with distinct anterior and posterior ends
